When the government of the People's Republic of China obtained its seat in the United Nations as a result of the UN General Assembly Resolution 2758 in 1971, it began to take diplomatic action to re-establish Chinese sovereignty over Hong Kong and Macau. Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai was especially concerned with the issue. On 25 April 1974, a group of low-ranking Portuguese officers organised a coup d'etat, overthrowing the right-wing ruling government that had been in power for 48 years. The new government began the democratisation of Portugal and the decolonisation of its remaining overseas possession. The new Portuguese government promised the return of Macau to Chinese rule. Both Portugal and the People's Republic of China recognised Macau as Chinese territory under temporary Portuguese administration, and agreed that the exact time for its return and related details would be discussed later between the two sides.

On 20 May 1986, the People's Republic of China, along with Portugal, officially announced that talks on Macanese affairs would take place in Beijing on 30 June 1986. The Portuguese delegation arrived in Beijing in June, and was welcomed by the Chinese delegation led by Zhou Nan. During the negotiations, Portuguese representatives offered to return Macau in 1985, but Chinese representatives rejected that year (as well rejecting previous requests for 1967, 1975, and 1977). China requested 1997, the same year as Hong Kong, but Portugal refused. 2004 was suggested by Portugal, as well as 2007 as that year would mark the 450th anniversary of Portugal renting Macau. However, China insisted for a year before 2000 as the Sino-British Joint Liaison Group in Hong Kong would be dissolved in 2000 as envisioned in 1986 (the Joint Liaison Group would be dissolved in 1999). Eventually the year 1999 was agreed upon.

On 20 May 1986, the People's Republic of China, along with Portugal, officially announced that talks on Macanese affairs would take place in Beijing on 30 June 1986. The Portuguese delegation arrived in Beijing in June, and was welcomed by the Chinese delegation led by Zhou Nan. During the negotiations, Portuguese representatives offered to return Macau in 1985, but Chinese representatives rejected that year (as well rejecting previous requests for 1967, 1975, and 1977). China requested 1997, the same year as Hong Kong, but Portugal refused. 2004 was suggested by Portugal, as well as 2007 as that year would mark the 450th anniversary of Portugal renting Macau. However, China insisted for a year before 2000 as the Sino-British Joint Liaison Group in Hong Kong would be dissolved in 2000 as envisioned in 1986. Eventually the year 1999 was agreed upon. In the afternoon of 19 December 1999, the 127th Portuguese Governor of Macau Vasco Joaquim Rocha Vieira lowered the flags in Macau, which was the prelude of the ceremony for the establishment of the Macau Special Administrative Region. The official transfer of sovereignty was held at midnight on that day at the Cultural Centre of Macau Garden.

In the Sino-British Joint Declaration, the People's Republic of China Government stated that it had decided to resume the exercise of sovereignty over Hong Kong with effect from 1 July 1997 and the United Kingdom Government declared that it would restore Hong Kong to the PRC with effect from 1 July 1997. In accordance with the "One country, two systems" principle agreed between the United Kingdom and the People's Republic of China, the socialist system of the People's Republic of China would not be practised in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR), and Hong Kong's previous capitalist system and its way of life would remain unchanged for a period of 50 years. This would leave Hong Kong unchanged until 2047. Chris Patten, the last governor of Hong Kong, introduced a package of electoral reforms in the Legislative Council. These reforms proposed to enlarge the electorate, thus making voting in the Legislative Council more democratic. This move posed significant changes because Hong Kong citizens would have the power to make decisions regarding their future. The handover ceremony was held at the new wing of the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre in Wan Chai on the night of 30 June 1997.
Dirty War
State authorities are currently carrying out systemic torture and suppression of dissident groups in the country.
Local Uprising

The Mexican miracle is a term used to refer to the country's inward-looking development strategy that produced sustained economic growth. It is considered to be a golden age of capitalism in Mexican economics in which the Mexican economy grew 4% each year. It was a stabilising economic plan which caused an average growth of 6.8% and industrial production to increase by 8% with inflation staying at only 2.5%. An important factor helping sustained growth in the period 1940-1970 was the reduction of political turmoil, particularly around national elections, with the creation of a single, dominant party. In the years following World War II, President Miguel Aleman Valdes (1946-52) instituted a full-scale import-substitution program which stimulated output by boosting internal demand. The government raised import controls on consumer goods but relaxed them on capital goods, which it purchased with international reserves accumulated during the war. The government spent it heavily on infrastructure, including major dam projects to produce hydroelectric power, supply drinking water to cities and irrigation water to agriculture, and control flooding.

The Mexican Dirty War refers to the Mexican theater of the Cold War, an internal conflict in the 1960s and 1970s between the Mexican PRI-ruled government under the presidencies of Gustavo Diaz Ordaz, Luis Echeverria and Jose Lopez Portillo, which were backed by the US government, and left-wing student and guerrilla groups. During the war, government forces carried out disappearances, estimated at 1,200, systematic torture, and "probable extrajudicial executions". The year 1960 marked the beginning of a decade of terror in the region of Guerrero as the state slowly began to deal with the citizens and peasants there ever-more violently. The state enacted the acts of suppression on Guerrero to keep the numerous different political reform movements stifled, as the local people over time grew agitated with the way the government was wielding its power and meddling with their rights. As the citizens grew more determined to speak out against the government in the 1960s, the PRI continued to increase its terror tactics in the region. While that was done to keep the populace under its control, the constant stream of violence pushed many guerrillas to consider raising up arms against the PRI.

Following a summer of increasingly large demonstrations in Mexico City protesting the 1968 Olympics held in Mexico City, the Mexican Armed Forces opened fire on October 2, 1968 on unarmed civilians, killing an undetermined number, in the hundreds. It occurred in the Plaza de las Tres Culturas in the Tlatelolco section of Mexico City. The events are considered part of the Mexican Dirty War, when the government used its forces to suppress political opposition. The massacre occurred 10 days before the Olympics' opening ceremony. The head of the Federal Directorate of Security reported that 1,345 people were arrested. At the time, the government and the media in Mexico claimed that government forces had been provoked by protesters shooting at them, but government documents made public since 2000 suggest that snipers had been employed by the government.

After the petroleum boom previous to the government of Mexican president Jose Lopez Portillo (from 1976 to 1982), the Mexican government began to rely heavily on export barrels to support the financial needs in the country. These exports were mainly directed towards the United States, mainly due to the petroleum crisis of 1973, taking advantage of the high prices these barrels garnered. When the market finally settled, thus reducing the high prices per barrel, the financial stability of the country was endangered. Diversification of income would have prevented the problem, but due to the inability of other production sectors to make up for the reduced profit, Mexico had to inflate the currency to by then historic levels. The Mexican peso would then be devaluated by almost 500%. Given these circumstances, Lopez Portillo nationalised all financial institutions in 1982, during his last public address to the nation by saying: "Defendere el peso como un perro".

In 1985 the Mexican government signaled a fundamental change in development strategy by reorienting economic policy toward trade liberalisation and export promotion. It expected renewed export promotion to restore external balance and trade liberalisation to restrain domestic prices by encouraging import competition. In July 1985, the government substantially reduced import licensing requirements and raised the share of total imports exempt from licensing. It compensated slightly for these measures by raising tariffs. The government also devalued the peso again, despite the inflationary consequences, to force previously protected domestic firms to become more competitive against imported goods. In late 1986, the government cautiously relaxed credit to the private sector in an effort to ease the economy out of recession. External financing was again made available in 1987 following approval of a debt rescheduling plan proposed by United States Secretary of the Treasury James A. Baker III.

The 1985 Mexico City earthquake struck in the early morning of 19 September at 07:17:50 (CST) with a moment magnitude of 8.0 and a maximal Mercalli intensity of IX (Violent). The event caused serious damage to the Greater Mexico City area and the deaths of at least 5,000 people. The sequence of events included a foreshock of magnitude 5.2 that occurred the prior May, the main shock on 19 September, and two large aftershocks. The first of these occurred on 20 September with a magnitude of 7.5 and the second occurred seven months later on 30 April 1986 with a magnitude of 7.0. They were located off the coast along the Middle America Trench, more than 350 kilometres (220 mi) away, but the city suffered major damage due to its large magnitude and the ancient lake bed that Mexico City sits on. The event caused between three and four billion USD in damage as 412 buildings collapsed and another 3,124 were seriously damaged in the city. At the time of the earthquake, Mexico was in its fourth year of a foreign debt crisis, and a contracting economy causing serious political problems for the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI). Much of the PRI's authoritarian nature was tolerated because the country had seen four decades of economic expansion of six percent or better. When this disappeared, the PRI's power base began to shrink.

The Mexican Dirty War refers to the Mexican theater of the Cold War, an internal conflict in the 1960s and 1970s between the Mexican PRI-ruled government under the presidencies of Gustavo Diaz Ordaz, Luis Echeverria and Jose Lopez Portillo, which were backed by the US government, and left-wing student and guerrilla groups. The legalisation of left-wing political parties in 1978 along with the amnesty of imprisoned and at large guerrillas caused a number of combatants to end militant struggle against the government. However, certain groups continued fighting, and the National Human Rights Commission states the hostilities continued into 1982.

El Halconazo or The Corpus Christi Massacre (The hawk strike, so called because of the participation of a government-trained paramilitary group known as Los Halcones) was a massacre of student demonstrators during the Mexican Dirty War in Mexico City on 10 June 1971, the day of the Corpus Christi festival. Nearly 120 protesters were killed, among them a fourteen-year-old boy. The number of dead in the demonstration discouraged many students, but also led others to be radicalised, some of whom later formed urban guerrilla organisations. Students in 1971 especially demanded the democratisation of education, control of the university budget by students and teachers, and that it represent 12% of the GDP. They also demanded political freedom wherein workers, peasants, students, and intellectuals could enjoy real democratic freedoms and control the social system, quality education for everyone, especially farmers and workers, greater respect for cultural diversity, strict democratic transparency, and support for the political union of the workers.

The 1988 Mexican general election was extremely important in Mexican history. The PRI's candidate, Carlos Salinas de Gortari, an economist who was educated at Harvard, had never held an elected office, and who was a technocrat with no direct link to the legacy of the Mexican Revolution even through his family. Rather than toe the party line, Cuauhtemoc Cardenas, the son of former President Lazaro Cardenas, broke with the PRI and ran as a candidate of the Democratic Current, later forming into the Party of Democratic Revolution (PRD). The PAN candidate Manuel Clouthier ran a clean campaign in long-standing pattern of the party. The election was marked by irregularities on a massive scale. The Ministry of the Interior (Gobernacion) controlled the electoral process, which meant in practice that the PRI controlled it. During the vote count, the government computers were said to have crashed, something the government called "a breakdown of the system". One observer said, "For the ordinary citizen, it was not the computer network but the Mexican political system that had crashed."

The Mexican peso crisis was a currency crisis sparked by the Mexican government's sudden devaluation of the peso against the U.S. dollar in December 1994, which became one of the first international financial crises ignited by capital flight. During the 1994 presidential election, the incumbent administration embarked on expansionary fiscal and monetary policy. Mexico enjoyed investor confidence and new access to international capital following its signing of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA). However, a violent uprising in the state of Chiapas, as well as the assassination of the presidential candidate Luis Donaldo Colosio, resulted in political instability, causing investors to place an increased risk premium on Mexican assets. The central bank devalued the peso on December 20, 1994, and foreign investors' fear led to an even higher risk premium. To discourage the resulting capital flight, the bank raised interest rates, but higher costs of borrowing merely hurt economic growth. Unable to sell new issues of public debt or efficiently purchase dollars with devalued pesos, Mexico faced a default. Two days later, the bank allowed the peso to float freely, after which it continued to depreciate. In the aftermath of the crisis, several of Mexico's banks collapsed amidst widespread mortgage defaults. The Mexican economy experienced a severe recession and poverty and unemployment increased.

President Ernesto Zedillo oversaw political and electoral reforms that reduced the PRI's hold on power. After the 1988 election, which was strongly disputed and arguably lost by the government, the IFE (Instituto Federal Electoral - Federal Electoral Institute) was created in the early 1990s. Run by ordinary citizens, the IFE oversees elections with the aim of ensuring that they are conducted legally and impartially.

The Zapatista Army went public on January 1, 1994, releasing their declaration on the day the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) came into effect. On that day, they issued their First Declaration and Revolutionary Laws from the Lacandon Jungle. The declaration amounted to a declaration of war on the Mexican government, which they considered illegitimate. Their initial goal was to instigate a revolution against the rise of neoliberalism throughout Mexico, but since no such revolution occurred, they used their uprising as a platform to call attention to their movement to protest the signing of the NAFTA, which the EZLN believed would increase inequality in Chiapas. The EZLN did not demand independence from Mexico, preferring autonomy, land access, and use of natural resources normally extracted from Chiapas. It also advocated for protection from violence and political inclusion of Chiapas' indigenous communities.

Vicente Fox Quesada is a Mexican businessman and politician who served as the 55th President of Mexico from 1 December 2000 to 30 November 2006. Campaigning as a right-wing populist, Fox ran for and was elected president on the National Action Party (PAN) ticket, which was an opposition party at the time of his election as president. Fox was elected President of Mexico in the 2000 presidential election, a historically significant election since it made him the first president elected from an opposition party since the election of Francisco I. Madero in 1910. Fox finished in first place with 42 percent of the vote, thus becoming the first presidential candidate in 71 years to defeat the Institutional Revolutionary Party (PRI). As president, he mostly followed the neoliberal economic policies that his predecessors from the PRI had adopted since the late 1980s. The first half of his administration saw a further shift of the Federal government to the right, strong relations with the United States and George W. Bush, unsuccessful attempts to apply a value-added tax to medicines and to build an airport in Texcoco, and a major diplomatic conflict with Cuban leader Fidel Castro.

The Cochabamba Water War was a series of protests that took place in Cochabamba, Bolivia's fourth largest city, between December 1999 and April 2000 in response to the privatisation of the city's municipal water supply company SEMAPA. The wave of demonstrations and police violence was described as a public uprising against water prices. The tensions erupted when a new firm, Aguas del Tunari - a joint venture involving Bechtel - was required to invest in construction of a long-envisioned dam (a priority of Mayor Manfred Reyes Villa) - so they had drastically raised water rates. Protests, largely organised through the Coordinadora in Defense of Water and Life, a community coalition, erupted in January, February, and April 2000, culminating in tens of thousands marching downtown and battling police. One civilian was killed. On 10 April 2000, the national government reached an agreement with the Coordinadora to reverse the privatisation. A complaint filed by foreign investors was resolved by agreement in February 2001.

THe last few weeks have been a terrible time for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government. The ruling party's poll numbers have dropped below that of our opposition while the current wave of discontent sweeping $COUNTRY$ continues unabated. The press' constant barrage of negative news has not helped the situation either as it has flamed even more anger against the government. The $MONARCHTITLE$ has therefore decided to make a statement at a government palace in $CAPITAL$ to soothe the current tensions and attempt to shift the narrative away from that of a government in chaos.

The Bolivian gas conflict was a social confrontation in Bolivia reaching its peak in 2003, centering on the exploitation of the country's vast natural gas reserves. On October 12, 2003 the government imposed martial law in El Alto after sixteen people were shot by the police and several dozen wounded in violent clashes which erupted when a caravan of oil trucks escorted by police and soldiers deploying tanks and heavy-caliber machine guns tried to breach a barricade. On October 18, Sanchez de Lozada's governing coalition was fatally weakened when the New Republic Force party withdrew its support. He was forced to resign and was replaced by his vice president, Carlos Mesa, a former journalist. The strikes and roadblocks were lifted. On July 18, 2004, Mesa put the issue of gas nationalisation to a referendum. On May 6, 2005, the Bolivian Congress passed a new law raising taxes from 18% to 32% on profits made by foreign companies on the extraction of oil and gas. Mesa failed to either sign or veto the law, so by law Senate President Hormando Vaca Diez was required to sign it into law on May 17. Many protesters felt this law was inadequate and demanded full nationalization of the gas and oil industry.

At a luxury hotel in $CAPITAL$ today, a major political figure in our party announced his intention to leave the party and form a new one to contest us in the next general election. He was not alone in his desire to vacate the party as numerous other disgruntled party members have also decided to join his new party. According to the new opposition leader, the impetus to defect from us was due to our poor handling of the government and the rise in discontent in $COUNTRY$ that he attributes our failure to govern to. Our party, whatever that remains of it, wishes to reaffirm our loyalty to you, our $MONARCHTITLE$!
Flood Barrier

After decades of begging and requesting Chile and Peru to grant Bolivia access to the sea, the dream is now a reality. With the transfer of Chilean territory in Arica to Bolivia, we now have access to the Pacific Ocean. We have finally reversed the ill effects of the War of the Pacific all those years ago.
Repeal the Second Amendment

The Second Amendment to the United States Constitution protects the individual right to keep and bear arms. It was ratified on December 15, 1791 as part of the Bill of Rights. This right to keep and bear arms has however led to a string of mass shootings throughout the country over the recent decades. Perhaps it is time to remove this unfettered constitutional right once and for all?

In 1975, the Chilean government of Augusto Pinochet made a proposal to Bolivia consisting in a swap of a narrow continuous corridor of Chilean land from the sea to the border between Chile and Bolivia, running parallel to the border between Chile and Peru, making the Lluta River Chile's northern border, in exchange for the same amount of Bolivian territory. The proposal involved former Peruvian land and according to the treaty of Ancon, Chile could not give former Peruvian territories to other nations without Peru's agreement. The dictator of Peru Francisco Morales-Bermudez was opposed to these changes but proposed to make Arica a territory governed by the three states. Chile responded that it could not accept this complicated shared sovereignty.

One year after the 2005 disengagement from the Gaza Strip by Israel, Hamas won the Palestinian legislative elections in January 2006, winning control of the Palestinian Legislative Council. Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East had stated that their continued aid to the PA under a Hamas government was conditional on Hamas' recognition of Israel, the disavowal of violent actions, and acceptance of previous agreements between Israel and the PA, including the Oslo Accords. When Hamas formed a government in March 2006 led by Ismail Haniya, refusing to accept these conditions, Israel and the Quartet stopped having any dialogue with the Palestinian Authority and especially any member of the Hamas government, ceased providing aid to the PA and imposed sanctions against the PA.

One year after the 2005 disengagement from the Gaza Strip by Israel, Hamas won the Palestinian legislative elections in January 2006, winning control of the Palestinian Legislative Council. Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East had stated that their continued aid to the PA under a Hamas government was conditional on Hamas' recognition of Israel, the disavowal of violent actions, and acceptance of previous agreements between Israel and the PA, including the Oslo Accords. When Hamas formed a government in March 2006 led by Ismail Haniya, refusing to accept these conditions, Israel and the Quartet stopped having any dialogue with the Palestinian Authority and especially any member of the Hamas government, ceased providing aid to the PA and imposed sanctions against the PA. Shortly after, in June, Hamas took control of the Gaza Strip during the Battle of Gaza, seizing government institutions and replacing Fatah and other government officials with Hamas members. Following the takeover, besides other measures, Israel and Egypt closed the border crossings with Gaza, marking the start of the blockade of the Gaza Strip.

The Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC) was established by President Alejandro Toledo to investigate the human rights abuses committed during the Internal conflict in Peru between 1980s and 1990s. The TRC was a response to the violent internal conflict between 1980 and 2000 during the administration of Presidents Fernando Belaunde (1980-1985), Alan Garcia (1985-1990), and Alberto Fujimori (1990-2000). The commission's mandate was to provide a record of human rights and international humanitarian law violations committed in Peru between May 1980 and November 2000, as well as recommend mechanisms to promote and strengthen human rights. The TRC reported on the estimated 70,000 deaths, assassinations, torture, disappearances, displacement, employment of terrorist methods and other human rights violations executed by the State, Shining Path, and the Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement. The report concluded that there is both institutional and individual accountability, as well as identifying racial and cultural factors that became a catalyst for conflict.

In 1945, Jose Bustamante had attained the presidency with the help of the American Popular Revolutionary Alliance (APRA). Soon, major disagreements arose between Victor Raul Haya de la Torre, the founder of APRA, and President Bustamante. The President disbanded his Aprista cabinet and replaced it with a mostly military one. Odria, a fierce opponent of APRA, was appointed Minister of Government and Police. In 1948, Odria and other right-wing elements urged Bustamante to ban APRA. When the President refused, Odria resigned his post. On October 27, 1948, he led a successful military coup against the government and took over as president. After two years, he resigned and had one of his colleagues, Zenon Noriega, take office as a puppet president so he could run for president as a civilian. He was duly elected a month later as the only candidate.

Odria came down hard on APRA, momentarily pleasing the oligarchy and all others on the right. Like Juan Peron, he followed a populist course that won him great favor with the poor and lower classes. A thriving economy allowed him to indulge in expensive but crowd-pleasing social policies. At the same time, however, civil rights in the nation were severely restricted and corruption was rampant throughout his regime. People feared that his dictatorship would run indefinitely, they were surprised when Odria legalized opposition parties in 1956 and called fresh elections. He did not run for office. He was succeeded by a former president, Manuel Prado.

Belaunde ran for president once again in the national elections of 1962 with his own party, Accion Popular. The results were very tight and he ended in second place, following Victor Raul Haya de la Torre (APRA), by less than 14,000 votes. Since none of the candidates managed to get the constitutionally established minimum of one third of the vote required to win outright, selection of the President should have fallen to Congress. The long-held antagonistic relationship between the military and APRA prompted Haya de la Torre to make a deal with former dictator Odria, who had come in third, which would have resulted in Odria taking the Presidency in a coalition government. However, widespread allegations of fraud prompted the Peruvian military to depose Prado and install a military junta, led by Ricardo Perez Godoy. Godoy ran a short transitional government and held new elections in 1963, which were won by Belaunde by a more comfortable but still narrow five percent margin.

Perez Godoy ran a short transitional government and held new elections in 1963, which were won by Belaunde by a more comfortable but still narrow five percent margin. During Belaunde's first term in office, he spurred numerous developmental projects. These included the Carretera Marginal de la Selva, a much-needed highway linking Chiclayo on the Pacific coast with then isolated northern regions of Amazonas and San Martin. He also advanced the ambitious Santiago Antunez de Mayolo and Chira Piura irrigation projects, and the Tinajones, Jequetepeque, Majes, Chavimochic, Olmos, Chinecas hydroelectric projects. Belaunde also oversaw the establishment of the Peruvian National Bank. To alleviate poverty, Belaunde also promoted a program of "social interest" homes in Lima and other cities, which benefited dozen thousands of families.

The MIR was born out of a split with the APRA, a formerly leftist group which increasingly began to collaborate with the government in the 1950s-60s. Following the 1963 election to the presidency of Fernando Belaunde Terry, and his failure to implement social reforms, the situation in the impoverished countryside became more critical. The first guerrilla movement, the ELN (National Liberation Army), appeared, but was quickly defeated by the military. 1964 was marked by the continuing failure of governmental reforms and clashes during land occupations by landless peasants, and the MIR launched its armed struggle the following year.

A dispute with the International Petroleum Company over licenses to the La Brea y Parinnas oil fields in Talara Province, northern Peru sparked a national scandal when a key page of a contract (the 11th) was found missing. The Armed Forces, fearing that this scandal might lead to another uprising or a takeover from the APRA party, seized absolute power and closed down Congress, almost all of whose members were briefly incarcerated. General Velasco seized power on October 3, 1968, in a bloodless military coup, deposing the democratically elected administration of Fernando Belaunde, under which he served as Commander of the Armed Forces. President Belaunde was sent into exile. Initial reaction against the coup evaporated after five days when on October 8, 1968, the oil fields in dispute were taken over by the Army.

A root and branch education reform was in march looking to include all Peruvians and move them towards to a new national thinking and feeling. The education reform of 1972 provided for bilingual education for the indigenous people of the Andes and the Amazon, which consisted nearly half of the population. In 1975, the Velasco government enacted a law making Quechua an official language of Peru equal to Spanish. A cornerstone of Velasco's political and economic strategy was the implementation by dictate of an agrarian reform program to expropriate farms and diversify land ownership. Peru's agrarian reform under Velasco was the second-largest Land reform in Latin American history, after Cuba. The former landlords who opposed this program believed that they did not receive adequate compensation for their confiscated assets and lamented that the state officials and peasant beneficiaries mismanaged their properties after the expropriation.

Relations between the United States and Peru were tense and even hostile, beginning as soon as General Velasco and his junta took power. Just five days after Velasco seized power in 1968, the General began the nationalisation of the Peruvian Economy with the expropriation and nationalisation of the American International Petroleum Company (IPC) oil fields located in the northern Peruvian oil port and refinery of Talara, Piura, near the Peruvian border with Ecuador, Piura, being the region where Velasco was born. US-Peru disagreements continued over a broad range of issues including even Peru's claim to a 200-mile fishing limit that resulted in the seizure of several US commercial fishing boats and the expropriation of the American copper mining company Cerro de Pasco Corporation. General Velasco's other main goal besides the nationalization of the main areas of the Peruvian economy and the agrarial reforms, was to strengthen Peru militarily. Despite Chilean fears that Velasco planned on reconquering the lands lost by Peru to Chile in the 1879 War of the Pacific, this was not Velasco's intention.

Economic difficulties such as inflation, unemployment, food shortages and increased political opposition after the 1974 crackdown on the press ultimately increased pressures on the Velasco Administration and led to its downfall. General Francisco Morales Bermudez replaced Velasco in 1975, citing Velasco's economic mismanagement and deteriorating health. Morales Bermudez moved the revolution into a more conservative "second phase", tempering the radical measures of the first phase and beginning the task of restoring the country's economy. A constitutional assembly was created in 1979, which was led by Victor Raul Haya de la Torre. Morales Bermudez presided over the return to civilian government in accordance with a new constitution drawn up in 1979.

The 1979 Constitution was promulgated on July 12, 1979 by a Constituent Assembly elected in June 1978 following 10 years of military rule and replaced the suspended 1933 Constitution. It became effective in 1980 with the re-election of deposed President Fernando Belaunde Terry. One of his first actions as President was the return of several newspapers to their respective owners. In this way, freedom of speech once again played an important part in Peruvian politics. Gradually, he attempted to undo some of the most radical effects of the Agrarian Reform initiated by Velasco, and reversed the independent stance that the Military Government of Velasco had with the United States.

When it first launched during the internal conflict in Peru in 1980, its goal was to overthrow the state by guerrilla warfare and replace it with a New Democracy. The Communist Party of Peru believed that by establishing a dictatorship of the proletariat, inducing a cultural revolution, and eventually sparking a world revolution, they could arrive at full communism. The Peruvian guerrillas were peculiar in that they had a high proportion of women. 50 per cent of the combatants and 40 per cent of the commanders were women. The Shining Path has been widely condemned for its brutality, including violence deployed against peasants, trade union organisers, elected officials and the general public. Since the capture of its leader Abimael Guzman in 1992, the Shining Path has declined in activity.

After a promising beginning, Belaunde's popularity eroded under the stress of inflation, economic hardship, and terrorism: per capita income declined, Peru's foreign debt burgeoned, and violence by leftist insurgents (notably Shining Path) rose steadily during the internal conflict in Peru, which was launched the day before Belaunde was elected in 1980. During the national elections of 1985, Belaunde's Party, Accion Popular, was defeated by APRA candidate Alan Garcia. However, as established in the 1979 Constitution, he would go on to serve in the Peruvian Senate as Senador Vitalicio ("senator for life"), a privilege for former Presidents abolished by the 1993 Constitution.

The North American Free Trade Agreement was an agreement signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, creating a trilateral trade bloc in North America. The agreement came into force on January 1, 1994, and superseded the 1988 Canada-United States Free Trade Agreement between the United States and Canada. Passage of NAFTA resulted in the elimination or reduction of barriers to trade and investment between the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. The effects of the agreement regarding issues such as employment, the environment, and economic growth have been the subject of political disputes. Most economic analyses indicated that NAFTA was beneficial to the North American economies and the average citizen, but harmed a small minority of workers in industries exposed to trade competition.
Neutral Country
Aggressor in a war

Europe is in ruins and ripe for communist revolutions. In particular, France and Italy have very strong indigenous communist movements that only need more support from the Soviet Union to increase their chance of electoral success. By spending some money and providing tacit political support to these movements, we can increase their popularity amongst the local populace in France and Italy such that they may be able to seize power in any upcoming elections.

Brezhnev: I wish to tell you confidentially and completely frankly that we in the Soviet leadership are supporters of your election as president to a new term as well. And we for our part will do everything we can to make that happen.

Ford: I thank you for that. I expect to be elected and I think that that meets the interests of the further development of Soviet-American relations, and of the cause of strengthening detente.

Brezhnev: Yes, on this matter we agree with you that this is precisely how it should be. Unfortunately, however, publicly you call us, the Soviet Union, adversaries, and in your conversations with us you say that we have common goals-transformation of detente into an irreversible process.

Ford: I can assure you, in full frankness, that I am absolutely prepared to dedicate all my efforts precisely to ensuring that relations between our countries develop steadily, and that detente becomes irreversible.
Defense Production Act Invoked
Our factories are currently churning out new weapons of war at the expense of producing other goods.
Invoke the Defense Production Act

The Act contains three major sections. The first authorises the $MONARCHTITLE$ to require businesses to accept and prioritise contracts for materials deemed necessary for national defense, regardless of a loss incurred on business. The law also allows the $MONARCHTITLE$ to designate materials to be prohibited from hoarding or price gouging. The second section authorises the $MONARCHTITLE$ to establish mechanisms (such as regulations, orders or agencies) to allocate materials, services and facilities to promote national defense. The third section authorises the $MONARCHTITLE$ to control the civilian economy so that scarce and critical materials necessary to the national defense effort are available for defense needs.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Government has fallen to $UNION_ADJ$ Pan Nationalists. The new leadership has therefore sent their ambassador to $CAPITAL$ with an offer to unite with $COUNTRY$. This is an offer we can refuse however it will provoke anger as it will be seen as a betrayal of the Pan-$UNION_ADJ$ Movement,
Leader with Term Limits
The New Constition
We have drafted a new liberal constitution that allows all states in the country to participate in a newly empowered parliament.
Reform the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Parliament

Under the current constitution, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ parliament is but a mere rubber stamp body for the $MONARCHTITLE$. This is however not an ideal situation because it deprives the government of any legitimacy to rule and only provokes the citizens to eventually revolt against us. By initiating reforms aimed at increasing the powers and political diversity in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ parliament, we can slowly transform $COUNTRY$ into a democratic state. These democratisation events will ultimately allow the Upper House and political parties to be democratic however voting reforms will still need to be passed using the usual way.
Become an Absolute Monarchy

For too long our monarch was just an empty figurehead draining our country's money. The government has sufficient support in the Upper House to pass a bill empowering our monarch with dictatorial powers. While some may be queasy with the idea of an absolute monarch, an argument can be made that being ruled by an enlightened dictator who has been raised to govern the country can lead to more stable and effective governance in $COUNTRY$.
Judiciary Subverted

The government recently passed a bill that undermined the nation's judiciary which paves the way forward for more unconstitutional amendments to strengthen the Head of State's power. We must however act fast to consolidate our power because the opposition will slowly erode the bill's effects overtime.
Executive Powers Extended

The government recently passed a bill that massively expanded the executive powers of the Head of State. The leader can now veto all legislation passed by parliament and his decision is now final. In addition, the oversight of parliament has also been eroded, allowing the leader to appoint key stakeholders in the nation's governance such as the judiciary, military and police with impunity. The leader also has the sole authority to effect changes to the constitution though the consent of parliament is still required but the decision cannot be challenged.
Constitution Amended
The government has recently passed a bill to strengthen the Head of State's power. We need more time before another similar legislation can be enacted.
Form the Danubian Federation

Ever since the fall of the Austro-Hungarian Empire, central europe has been filled with many small independent states. These states were weak on their own and were easily conquered, first in the Second World War by the Germans and later by the Soviet Union during the Cold War. A new idea has sprung up amongst the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ elite that we should form a central european federation - a Danubian Federation, to prevent these weak states from being dominated again.
Block $COUNTRY_ADJ$ puppets from seeking independence

This decision will prevent puppets of $COUNTRY$ from demanding independence via the generic independence system. It does not prevent independence via historical events. Moreover, it does not prevent your puppets from using the Become Independent CB to attain independence by force. Mandates will still be allowed to seek independence since we have no right to continue to hold onto them. The decision will also greatly increase the risk of pro-independence rebels rising up against our puppet governments.
Allow $COUNTRY_ADJ$ puppets to demand independence

This decision will allow the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ puppets to demand independence via the generic independence system. How far separatist demands will go toward full independence, and whether groups pursue constitutional and nonviolent action or armed violence, depend on a variety of economic, political, social and cultural factors, including movement leadership and the government's response.

A growing fear of an all out nuclear war between our country and our enemy is brewing in the minds of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people. This is because both parties in the current conflict are nuclear weapons armed. To many citizens, it appears inevitable that either side will use these weapons of mass destruction unless peace is found soon. Unless we find a way to remove this fear of mutually assured destruction, the pacifist movement in $COUNTRY$ will only continue to grow.

Osama bin Laden was killed in Abbottabad, Pakistan, on May 2, 2011, shortly after 1 AM local time by a United States military special operations unit. The operation, code-named Operation Neptune Spear, was ordered by United States President Barack Obama and carried out in a Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) operation by a team of United States Navy SEALs from the United States Naval Special Warfare Development Group of the Joint Special Operations Command, with support from CIA operatives on the ground. The raid on bin Laden's compound in Abbottabad was launched from Afghanistan. After the raid, reports at the time stated that U.S. forces had taken bin Laden's body to Afghanistan for positive identification, then buried it at sea, in accordance with Islamic law, within 24 hours of his death.

On October 26-27, 2019, the United States conducted Operation Kayla Mueller, a military operation named after Kayla Mueller, that resulted in the death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the then-leader and self-proclaimed "caliph" of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) terror organisation. The operation took place in the outskirts of Barisha, Idlib Governorate, Syria. According to General Kenneth "Frank" McKenzie, the United States Central Command (CENTCOM) commander who oversaw the operation, Baghdadi killed himself along with two children when he detonated a suicide belt while seeking to evade the U.S. forces during the raid.
Form the United Provinces of the Rio de la Plata

The United Provinces of the Rio de la Plata, earlier known as the United Provinces of South America, a union of provinces in the Rio de la Plata region of South America, emerged from the May Revolution in 1810 and the Argentine War of Independence of 1810-1818. It comprised most of the former Viceroyalty of the Rio de la Plata dependencies and had Buenos Aires as its capital.
Form the Polish-Czechoslovak Confederation

The Polish-Czechoslovak confederation, or federation, was a political concept from the time of World War II, supported by the Polish government-in-exile and, to a lesser extent, the United Kingdom and the United States. It was a revitalisation of the Mi?dzymorze concept, proposing the creation of a federation based on Poland and Czechoslovakia. The project had less support in the Czechoslovak government-in-exile, which believed it did not need Polish support against the Soviet Union, and was eventually sunk by the growing Soviet dominance, as Joseph Stalin did not want a strong and independent federation in Europe that could threaten his designs for Eastern Europe.

The Polish-Czechoslovak confederation, or federation, was a political concept from the time of World War II, supported by the Polish government-in-exile and, to a lesser extent, the United Kingdom and the United States. It was a revitalisation of the Mi?dzymorze concept, proposing the creation of a federation based on Poland and Czechoslovakia. The project had less support in the Czechoslovak government-in-exile, which believed it did not need Polish support against the Soviet Union, and was eventually sunk by the growing Soviet dominance, as Joseph Stalin did not want a strong and independent federation in Europe that could threaten his designs for Eastern Europe.
Police Action Underway

The nation's security forces are currently enforcing the suppression plans as laid out in the state of emergency declaration to restore public order. They estimate that the operation can only be completed within a month. Until then, we cannot lift the state of emergency unless there is an election.

The Paquisha War was a military clash that took place between January and February 1981 between Ecuador and Peru over the control of three watchposts. While Peru felt that the matter was already decided in the Ecuadorian-Peruvian War of 1941, Ecuador did not agree with the Rio de Janeiro Protocol. Later in 1998 the Guarantors of the Rio Protocol ruled that the border of the undelimited zone was indeed the line of the Cordillera del Condor, as Peru had been claiming since the 1940s. In the aftermath of the incident, both sides increased their military presence along the Cordillera del Condor area and Cenepa Valley, starting an escalating spiral of tension and provocation that finally resulted in another military confrontation in 1995, the Cenepa War.
Mesoamerican-Spanish
Establish the Brazilian Development Bank

The National Bank for Economic and Social Development is a development bank structured as a federal public company associated with the Ministry of Development, Industry, and Trade of Brazil. The stated goal is to provide long-term financing for endeavors that contribute to the country's development. Since its establishment on June 20, 1952, BNDES has financed large-scale industrial and infrastructure endeavors and has played a significant role in the support of investments in agriculture, commerce, and the service industry, as well as in small- and medium-sized private businesses, even though its focus lies on larger firms. The bank has supported social investments aimed at education and health, family agriculture, basic sanitation and mass transportation.

The COVID-19 pandemic, also known as the coronavirus pandemic, is an ongoing pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID?19), caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS?CoV?2). The outbreak was first identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. The pandemic has caused severe global economic disruption, including the largest global recession since the Great Depression. It has led to the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, widespread supply shortages exacerbated by panic buying, and decreased emissions of pollutants and greenhouse gases. Schools, universities, and colleges have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 186 countries, affecting approximately 98.5 per cent of the world's student population. Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people and against those perceived as being Chinese, or as being from areas with high infection rates.
Purchase Vaccine for Viral Epidemic

Scientists in a greater power or a neighbouring country have sucessfully created a vaccine for the virus currently ravaging throughout the world after much blood, sweat and testing. This removes the need for our country to independently create our own vaccine however the countries with the vaccine are only willing to give us their drugs if we do not have negative relations with them. This diseases is still tied to many political issues after all.
Requested Foreign Soldiers
We have recently requested Foreign Soldiers to aid us in our ongoing conflict
Request for Foreign Soldiers

We have some allies who do not wish to join our war fully however they can still be involved in it by sending a small task force to bolster the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Army. For each country that accepts our invitation to send a task force, our soldier population will increase by 5% while our officer population will increase by 1%. We will also get some war exhaustion reduction if they accept but gain war exhaustion if they refuse.

Our "faithful" ally, $FROMCOUNTRY$, has requested that the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government provide a small task force to assist in their ongoing conflict. While this will not involve us officially in their war, it will not be popular amongst our citizens who may view it as just another pointless foray into a matter best left to the warring parties. We can however gain some benefits from paying "the blood price". This will be in the form of better relations and if we are a Great Power, more diplomatic influence in $FROMCOUNTRY$.

The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Government has declined our humble request to send a small task force to aid our ongoing war. This is a massive betrayal by the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ people which will not be forgotten anytime soon!
Embrace Mohammad Khatami's Reforms

Mohammad Khatami was elected as the President of Iran in 1997 after having based his campaign on a reform program promising implementation of a democratic and more tolerant society, the rule of law and improvement of social rights. After taking office, Khatami faced fierce opposition from his powerful opponents within the unelected institutions of the state which he had no legal power over, and this led to repeated clashes between his government and these institutions. After 8 years of presidency, he is widely considered to have lost the power struggle with his opponents. This decision will open up the Upper House to all ideologies which you can then use to pass democratic reforms.
Establish the Quds Force

The Quds Force is a unit in Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) specialising in unconventional warfare and military intelligence operations. It is an organisation roughly analogous to a combination of the CIA and the Joint Special Operations Command (JSOC) in the United States. Responsible for extraterritorial operations, the Quds Force supports non-state actors in many countries, including Lebanese Hezbollah, Hamas and Palestinian Islamic Jihad in the Gaza Strip and the West Bank, Yemeni Houthis, and Shia militias in Iraq, Syria, and Afghanistan. Analysts estimate the Quds has 10,000-20,000 members. The Quds Force reports directly to the Supreme Leader of Iran, the Ayatollah.

The $MONARCHTITLE$ recently dismissed the democratically elected government of the country and replaced it with a minority party. Many citizens were shocked by this sudden development and are now calling the $MONARCHTITLE$'s decision a constitutional overreach - for some, a coup. This will not sit well with the people who have already taken to the streets to protest. $MONARCHTITLE$, you must act quickly to stem this rising discontent lest it turns into your defining legacy of shame.
Appoint a New Government

Under the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Constitution, the Head of State, the $MONARCHTITLE$, is empowered with the authority to dismiss and appoint a new Head of Government to head the Legislature. This power however comes with great responsibility as appointing a minority government can trigger a constitutional crisis which can lead to a civil war in the country if there is sufficient militancy.

Constitutional scholars have descended upon $CAPITAL$ to participate in the first national Constitutional Conference hosted by the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government. The agenda is to decide what form of republican government the country should adopt. The scholars are however split evenly amongst the 3 possible types of republican governments we can adopt. Presidential republics are ones where there is an executive presidency separate from the legislature. A semi-presidential republic is one where there is an executive presidency and a separate head of government that leads the rest of the executive, who is appointed by the president and accountable to the legislature. A parliamentary republic is one with a ceremonial and non-executive president, where a separate head of government leads the executive and is dependent on the confidence of the legislature. Each type comes with a different set of challenges for the ruling party controlling power.
Become a Presidential Republic

A presidential system is a democratic and republican government in which a head of government leads an executive branch that is separate from the legislative branch. This head of government is in most cases also the head of state, which is called president. In presidential countries, the executive is elected and is not responsible to the legislature, which cannot in normal circumstances dismiss it. The leader can only be removed via impeachment which requires that the Upper House has opposition support of more than 66%. This also gives the President the ability to issue executive orders.
Become a Semi-Presidential Republic

A semi-presidential system or dual executive system is a system of government in which a president exists alongside a prime minister and a cabinet, with the latter being responsible to the legislature of the state. It differs from a parliamentary republic in that it has a popularly elected head of state, who is more than a mostly ceremonial figurehead, and from the presidential system in that the cabinet, although named by the president, is responsible to the legislature, which may force the cabinet to resign through a motion of no confidence. The President can dismiss and appoint a new Head of Government though this can lead to a constitutional crisis if the new party is not a majority party. The President can also be impeached.
Become a Parliamentary Republic

A parliamentary republic is a republic that operates under a parliamentary system of government where the executive branch (the government) derives its legitimacy from and is accountable to the legislature (the parliament). There are a number of variations of parliamentary republics. Most have a clear differentiation between the head of government and the head of state, with the head of government holding real power, much like constitutional monarchies. The President cannot dismiss and appoint a new government and the government can only fall if there is a vote of no confidence.
Host a Regional Peace Summit in $CAPITAL$

Diplomats and other senior $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government figures in $CAPITAL$ are suggesting we organise a summit with other democratic leaders around the region to discuss the current issues of our time. Maintaining good relations with other democratic countries is of vital importance if we aim to bring the democratic values to all the countries in the world. As Thomas Paine wrote: "The Republics of Europe are all (and we may say always) in peace."
Regional Summit Participant
We recently organised a summit with other democratic nations, bringing us all closer together

The Monarch, acting in capacity of the Head of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ State, has issued a royal edict calling for the end of the current state of emergency. This is in light of the fact that the average militancy in $COUNTRY$ has dipped below 3 such that the draconian emergency powers are no longer needed. $MONARCHTITLE$, as we are only the Head of Government, we have two choices available to us - respect the Monarch's decision or to abolish the monarchy altogether. The latter choice will infuriate the conservatives and traditionalists in our country.

The ruling party's upper house support has been eroded by a series of acts passed by the opposition in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ parliament to curtail the autocratic use of power by the $MONARCHTITLE$. These acts of parliament are however capable of being vetoed using the emergency powers currently accorded to the $MONARCHTITLE$. An opportunity has arisen for the $MONARCHTITLE$ to overturn those restrictive acts and restore the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government's autocratic power. Failure to veto those acts will cause us to lose our majority power in the Upper House.
Close the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Concentration Camps

Closing our concentration camp network will free our forced labourers to return to their homes to begin a new life of freedom - and paid work for the greater good of $COUNTRY$. We must however be careful with ending our concentration camps if we are a dictatorship because it will lead to a surge in dissident thought that can eventually cause the government to fall.

In light of the recent democratisation of $COUNTRY$, the newly installed government has enacted a piece of legislation to dismantle the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ concentration camp network and to free all forced labourers. These newly liberated prisoners will be able to return to their homes to begin a new life of freedom - and paid work for the greater good of $COUNTRY$.

$COUNTRY$ has grown larger or more populous hence there is now a need for more concentration camps to properly control our populace. As such, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Secret Police have opened new camps to meet this increase demand to store our nation's dissidents.
Retake Foreign Enclaves in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Territory

Neighbouring territories that rightfully belong to us but are under occupation by a foreign power are currently landlocked, defenseless against out de facto occupation. We should invade those exclaves to restore them to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. This will however have a 30% risk of war with the target country.
Landlocked

Parts of $COUNTRY$ are currently enclaves within another country. These enclaves are single provinces with no adjacent coast or owned province. This is a risky situation because they are vulnerable to sudden invasions by the surrounding country. This is especially likely to occur if we have an ongoing revolution or is disarmed. If the country does choose to invade our enclaves, we will have no choice but to declare war or to back down.
Due to the recent changes to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ borders, we no longer have single province enclaves that are vulnerable to sudden invasions. The risk of sudden invasions has abated, for now.

$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Government has decided to invade and occupy the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ enclaves in $FROMCOUNTRY$. This is a perilous situation because we cannot defend those enclaves short of an all out war with $FROMCOUNTRY$. $MONARCHTITLE$, what will be your response?

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has lost the war and as part of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ peace treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$, the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Government will return all lands containing $COUNTRY_ADJ$ cores to us. This will be a tremendous day in the restoration of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ greatness.
$COUNTRY$ has lost the war and as part of the Treaty of $CAPITAL$, they must return all lands held by the victorious power who demanded that their cored lands be returned to them.
Enlarge the Arab Federation

The Federation was formed on 14 February 1958, when King Faisal II of Iraq and his cousin, King Hussein of Jordan, sought to unite their two Hashemite kingdoms, as a response to the formation of the United Arab Republic between Egypt and Syria. The union lasted only six months, being officially dissolved on 2 August 1958, after Faisal was deposed by a military coup on 14 July.
Copt
Employing Mercenaries

Rampant anti-war sentiments have taken root in $COUNTRY$. This has incited the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people to begin a campaign of civil disobediance against our war efforts. This is a huge betrayal of our people to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ cause and must be dealth with harshly. The Minister for War has proposed that we execute those involved in this as an example for others.

A demonstration against the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government's involvement in a war has broken out in $CAPITAL$. These protestors demand that the government find a peaceful solution to the conflict before more lives are lost. Naturally, their words have fallen on deaf ears by the war hawks in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Cabinet.

During the recent bombardment of $CAPITAL$, a stray bomb managed to strike a critical hub of our nuclear launch network. This has caused the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military to be unable to fire its nuclear arsenal until the damage is repaired. This makes us extremely vulnerable to foreign nuclear strikes as we will be unable to retaliate until the damage is fixed. While our engineers are busy surveying and applying the necessary repairs, it will still take around 60 days for the nuclear arsenal to be operable again.
Nuclear System Disabled
Our military engineers are busy repairing the damage to the nuclear system to enable us to retaliate against any nuclear attacks.
Offshore Haven

Many rich and powerful elites, often with shady backgrounds, have chosen this province to deposit their ill gotten gains or mask their incomes to avoid the tax man. This influx of cash has made the city's upper class residents very rich.
Kleptocracy
This province has a kleptocrat as its mayor which has led to the draining of the city's coffers into the city's elite at the expense of the other less fortunate classes.
Vote Rigging
Local city mayors have been instructed by the Central Government to embark on a massive and comprehensive mission to rig the vote in favour of the ruling party.

The Asian Relations Conference took place in New Delhi in March-April 1947. It was hosted by Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru, who then headed a provisional government that was preparing for India's Independence, which came on 15 August 1947. The Asian Relations Conference brought together many leaders of the independence movements in Asia, and represented a first attempt to assert Asian unity. The objectives of the conference were "to bring together the leading men and women of Asia on a common platform to study the problems of common concern to the people of the continent, to focus attention on social, economic and cultural problems of the different countries of Asia, and to foster mutual contact and understanding."

Petrov made contact with the Australian Security Intelligence Organisation (ASIO) and offered to provide evidence of Soviet espionage in exchange for political asylum. The defection was arranged by Michael Bialoguski, a Polish doctor and musician, and part-time ASIO agent, who had cultivated Petrov for nearly two years, befriending him and taking him to visit prostitutes in Sydney's King's Cross area. Bialoguski introduced Petrov to a senior ASIO officer, Ron Richards, who offered Petrov asylum plus 5,000 pounds in exchange for all the documents he could bring with him from the embassy. Planning for Petrov's defection was codenamed Operation Cabin 12, after a briefer period of being designated Operation Cabin 11, following the standard practice of referring to potential defectors as "Cabin Candidates". Petrov defected on 3 April 1954.
Consolidate the Vietnamese states into a united Vietnam

Following Vietnamese victory against the French in the First Indochina War, which ended in 1954, the nation was divided into two rival states, communist North and anti-communist South. Conflicts intensified in the Vietnam War, which saw extensive US intervention in support of South Vietnam and ended with North Vietnamese victory in 1975. We are now in control of the Vietnamese states or provinces such that we can proceed to unite the Vietnamese state into a single nation. This new nation will be under our control.

Enemy bomber aircraft have attacked the City of $PROVINCENAME$ in an attempt to destroy critical infrastructure and military installations. The heavy bombardment has inflicted heavy damage to the city and has increased the level of defeatism amongst the local populace. As the scores of people bury their dead in the outskirts of the damaged city, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government vows to continue the war, no matter the cost.

$CAPITAL$ was attacked by enemy bomber aircraft and missiles last night. The bombing was relentless and destructive, ravaging large swarths of $CAPITAL$ and turning parts of it into a fiery hell. This bombing campaign has left our capital in ruins and will take some time before we can return it to its former glory.
Recent Draft Lottery
The government has recently held a draft lottery to quickly press men into active service.
Hold an Emergency Draft

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Government can hold an emergency draft lottery to immediately press some of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens into active service. This will however lead to less skilled military units but might give us sufficient soldiers to tide out the war until we can properly train a better professional army. This one time off impressment of our citizens will also dampen morale by increasing our war exhaustion.

The Dhofar Rebellion was waged from 1962 to 1976 in the province of Dhofar against the Sultanate of Muscat and Oman. The war began with the formation of the Dhofar Liberation Front, a group which aimed to create an independent state in Dhofar, free from the rule of the Omani Sultan Said bin Taimur. The rebels also held the broader goals of Arab nationalism which included the ending British influence in the Gulf region. The war initially took the form of a low level insurgency with guerrilla warfare being used against Omani forces and the foreign presence in the country. A number of factors such as the British withdrawal from Aden and support from China and the Soviet Union brought the rebels increased success, with the communists controlling the entirety of the Jebel region by the late 1960s. The 1970 Omani coup d'etat led to the overthrow of Sultan Said bin Taimur by his reformist son Qaboos bin Said who was backed by a major British military intervention in the conflict.
Begin the Germanisation of Austria

Historically, Austrians were regarded as ethnic Germans and viewed themselves as such. The end of World War II in 1945 saw the re-establishment of an independent Austria, although the Allied Powers remained in occupation until 1955, when the Austrian State Treaty between Austria and them was signed to end occupation and to regain Austrian sovereignty. Immediately after 1945 the majority of Austrians still saw themselves as Germans, as a broader Austrian national identity took time to develop.
Cultivate an Austrian National Identity

Historically, Austrians were regarded as ethnic Germans and viewed themselves as such. Since the fall of the Third Reich and the events of World War II, both the political ideology of pan-Germanism and the union with Germany have become discredited due to their association with Nazism, allowing Austrians to develop their own separate and distinct national identity. Today, the vast majority of Austrians do not identify as German.
1949년 11월 26일, 제헌의회가 B. R. 암베드카르가 이끄는 위원회가 초안을 작성한 인도 헌법을 채택했습니다. 인도는 헌법이 발효된 1950년 1월 26일을 공화국의 날로 지정했으며, 입헌군주제를 폐지하고 연방민주공화국을 수립했습니다. 정부의 구조는 영국과 비슷하지만 연방제 안에 속해 있었습니다. 초대 대통령은 라젠드라 프라사드가 맡았습니다.

걸프만 아랍국가협력협의회는 이라크를 제외한 페르시아만의 모든 아랍국가, 즉 바레인, 쿠웨이트, 오만, 카타르, 사우디아라비아, 아랍에미리트로 구성된 지역 간 정치경제 연합체입니다. 1981년 5월 25일 기구의 천장이 조인됐고 공식적으로 출범했습니다. 원래 2,673,110 평방킬로미터에 이르는 이 조합은 바레인, 쿠웨이트, 오만, 카타르, 사우디아라비아, 아랍에미리트의 연합으로 이루어졌습니다. 1981년 11월 11일에는 걸프협력회의 회원국 간의 통일된 경제협정이 아랍에미리트 아부다비에서 체결됐습니다. 이 나라들은 종종 '걸프 국가'로 불립니다.

공식적으로 제15회 올림피아드 대회로 알려진 1952년 하계 올림픽은 1952년 7월 19일부터 8월 3일까지 핀란드 헬싱키에서 열린 국제 복합 스포츠 대회입니다. 헬싱키는 일찍이 제2차 세계대전으로 인해 취소된 1940년 하계 올림픽의 개최지로도 선정〈 바 있습니다. 이 도시는 하계 올림픽이 열린 도시 중에서 최북단에 있습니다. 또한 인도유럽어권 국가가 아닌 곳에서 처음으로 열린 올림픽입니다. 2008년 베이징 하계 올림픽까지 역대 최다 세계 신기록이 깨진 올림픽이기도 했습니다. 소련, 중국, 홍콩, 인도네시아, 이스라엘, 태국, 자를란드는 1952년 헬싱키에서 올림픽에 처음 출전했습니다. 미국이 금메달과 종합 메달을 제일 많이 딴 올림픽이기도 합니다.
붉은 동방

공산당이 중국에서 승리했습니다. 동유럽은 빨갛게 물들었습니다. 이러한 새로운 현실과 소련의 핵무기 개발 성공으로 인한 미국의 핵무기 독점 종식에 직면한 트루먼 행정부는 신속하게 견제 원칙을 강화하고 확장하기 위해 움직였습니다. 독일과 일본의 재무장을 시작으로, 미국은 공산국가의 침략에 대항하는 방벽의 형성을 시도했습니다. 철의 장막 뒷편에서, 소련은 동유럽에서의 자신의 권력을 공고히 하고 중국, 인도와 더 좋은 관계를 구축하고 있습니다. 초강대국이 강해지는 반면, 옛 식민제국은 점점 쇠락하고 있습니다. 인도의 탈식민지화와 함께 식민제국들에게 변화의 바람이 불고 있습니다. 이 식민제국들이 역사책에나 남게 되는 것은 시간문제입나다. 더 즉각적인 위험은 민족주의자들이 통일전쟁을 적극적으로 선동하고 있는 한반도에서 긴장이 고조되고 있다는 점입니다. 지금이야말로 나라를 발전시킬 위대한 지도자가 필요한 큰 격변의 시기입다. 그 지도자가 당신일까요?
신도시
국내의 한 도시가 세계의 부러움을 받고 있습니다. 이 도시는 강력한 기반시설망과 좋은 학교, 우수한 사회 복지를 자랑합니다. 전세계의 신문들은 지난 며칠 동안 기사에서 이 도시에 대해 좋은 칭찬들과 함께 $COUNTRY$ 정부를 빛낸 지구상에서 가장 이상적인 도시라고 묘사했습니다. 마침내 우리나라에 모범적인 도시가 생겼다는 사실을 자랑할 수 있습니다.
$COUNTRY$이(가)가 독립했습니다. 이를 통해 우리 $COUNTRY$이(가) 본토에 통합되는 사태를 피할 수 있었습니다. 국민들은 새로 획득한 자결권을 즐기면서 기뻐합니다. $CAPITAL$의 신정부는 지금이 우리에게 새로운 시대의 여명임을 천명했습니다.

$COUNTRY의 자치권 보호에 대한 $MONARCHTITLE$의 비타협적 태도에 화가 난 시위대가 $CAPITAL$의 의회를 습격하고 쓰레기를 투척했습니다. 시위대는 $COUNTRY$의 독립을 의미하는 깃발을 내걸고 가구를 파괴했습니다. 진압대가 청사 안으로 진입하기 전에 시위대가 도주하면서 안타깝게도 경찰은 그들을 체포하지 못했습니다. 이는 시위대를 고무시켰고 국내에서 민족주의에 대한 지지를 드높였습니다.
통합 지연

중앙정부가 교육제도과 $COUNTRY$의 정치제도를 본토와 같게 하는 개혁을 실시하기로 결정했습니다. 이 때문에 완전한 통합이 이뤄질 때까지 본토가 서서히 $COUNTRY$의 자치권을 잠식하려 하는 시도라는 우려가 일고 있습니다. 이번 일은 $COUNTRY$ 주민들에게 나쁜 소식입니다. $COUNTRY$의 합병이 5년 안에 이뤄질 수 있게 됐기 때문입니다.
특별행정구역 장관이 $FROMCOUNTRY의 정치제도를 본토와 같게 하는 개혁을 실시해달라는 중앙정부의 요청을 거부했습니다. 이 때문에 개혁을 강행하지 않는 한 본토로의 통합 계획은 지연될 것입니다. 다만 일부 장관은 이 일이 $FROMCOUNTRY$의 독립 추구로 이어질 수 있으므로 이에 반대할 것을 권고하고 있습니다.

중앙정부가 마침내 $COUNTRY$ 정부의 정치기관을 통합함으로써 $COUNTRY$의 자율성은 본토와 비슷해졌습니다. 이러한 맥락에서, 오늘 중앙정부는 $COUNTRY$이(가) 통합될 것이라 발표했습니다. 중앙정부는 통합 과정 전반에 걸쳐 변함없이 충성해준 $MONARCHITLE$에게 감사를 표하며, 그를 중앙정부 내각의 고위 각료로 승진시켰습니다. $CATITAL$의 민족주의자들은 $COUNTRY$ 시민들이 누려온 자치권을 되살리려면 $COUNTRY$ 정부가 일방적인 독립선언서를 발표해야 한다며 봉기했습니다.
$FROMCOUNTRY$이(가) $COUNTRY$을(를) 중앙에 통합하려던 시도를 거부했습니다. 이제 그들의 일방적인 독립선언을 수용하거나 무력을 통해 합병 전쟁을 하는 두 가지 선택만을 남겨두고 있습니다. 그러나 만약 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 주민의 자기결정권을 없앤다면 국제사회는 우리를 극도로 비판할 것입니다.

$COUNTRY$ 자치권을 축소하는 개혁을 통과시키겠다는 $COUNTRY$ 정부의 결정이 있은 후 $COUNTRY$ 전반에 걸쳐 대규모 시위가 벌어졌습니다. 비록 $COUNTRY 주민들은 중앙정부의 지시를 받아들일 수밖에 없었음에도 국민들은 그 어느 것도 듣지 못하고 있습니다. 그들은 $COUNTRY$ 정부에게 통합 시 본토의 추가 시도를 거부하라고 요구합니다. $MONARCHTITLE$께서는 국민의 뜻을 존중하시겠습니까, 아니면 대신 직위 유지를 위해 중앙정부의 노선을 계속 따르시겠습니까?

$COUNTRY$ 정부가 특별행정구역의 자치권을 축소할 수 있는 개혁을 통과시키자 $COUNTRY$ 주민들이 분노하고 있습니다. 한 무리의 학생들이 분노를 표출하고 자치권 확대를 요구하기 위해 $CAPITAL$ 대학에 장애물을 설치하기로 결정했습니다. 이 때문에 불행히도 시내 중심부의 주요 도로가 이러한 장애물로 인해 차단됐습니다. 현재 다른 도로에서는 교통 체증이 발생했고 도심은 마비 상태입니다. $MONARCHTITLE$께서는 국민의 뜻을 존중하시겠습니까, 아니면 대신 직위 유지를 위해 중앙정부의 노선을 계속 따르시겠습니까?

$COUNTRY$ 정부가 특별행정구역의 자치권을 축소할 수 있는 개혁을 통과시키자 $COUNTRY$ 주민들이 분노하고 있습니다. 그 결과, $MONARCHTITLE$의 퇴진을 요구하는 시민들도 늘고 있습니다. 사의 표명은 궁극적인 통합 중단에는 별 도움을 주지 못 할 것입니다. 단, 3년 더 지연시킬 수는 있습니다. 애당초 이러한 개혁을 받아들일지 여부를 선택할 수 없었던 상황에서 $MONARCHTITLE$이(가) 이번 사태의 희생양이 된 사실이 유감일 뿐입니다. 사람들에게는 단두대에 올릴 머리가 필요한데, $MONARCHTITLE$가 이들에게 머리를 제공할 수 있을까요?
$COUNTRY$ 특별행정구역 통합 시작
국내에는 중앙정부에게서 독립된 특별행정구역이 일부 있습니다. 그 특별행정구역의 지방과 정치에 대한 완전한 통제권을 가지고 있다는 점은 바람직하지 않습니다. 이렇게 되면 우리나라가 약해질 뿐입니다. 그러므로 이러한 행정구역들을 통합하는 과정에 착수해야 합니다. 이들을 완전히 통합하는 데는 약 20년이 걸릴 것으로 보입니다.
$COUNTRY$ 특별행정구역 통합 취소
국내에는 중앙정부에게서 독립된 특별행정구역이 일부 있습니다. 그러나 이러한 행정구역의 통합이 처음 생각했던 것보다 어려우며, 또한 그곳 주민들의 자기결정권을 박탈하는 행위이기도 하다는 사실이 증명됐습니다.
권력 이양 주민투표 실패
생제르맹앙레 조약 폐기

보헤미아 왕국은 체코슬로바키아가 세워진 1918년에 멸망했습니다. 체코슬로바키아는 제1차 세계대전 말기인 1918년 10월 생제르맹앙레 조약에 따라 세워진 오스트리아-헝가리 제국의 후계국 중 하나입니다. 영토는 오늘날의 보헤미아, 모라비아, 슬로바키아, 카르파티아 루테니아에 걸쳐 있었으며 구 오스트리아-헝가리 지역에서 가장 산업화된 지역을 상당수 포함했습니다.
유고슬라비아 내의 구 오스트리아령 영유권 주장

유고슬라비아는 1918년 구 오스트리아-헝가리 제국의 영토에서 결성된 슬로베니아인 크로아티아인 세르비아인국이 그 전부터 독립국으로 존속하던 세르비아 왕국과 합병하면서 세워졌습니다. 몬테네그로 왕국은 세르비아와 유고슬라비아 수립 5일 전에야 연합한 반면, 코소보, 보이보디나, 바르다르 마케도니아, 보스니아의 대부분은 이미 세르비아의 일부였습니다. 오스트리아-헝가리를 더 강하게 만들기 위해 이 영토들을 다시 한 번 되찾아야 합니다.
지방자치정부
주민들은 한층 고차원의 권력 이양에 찬성했습니다. 이것은 그들에게 더 큰 자치권을 주는 특별행정구역이 형성됨을 의미합니다. 그들은 여전히 우리나라의 구성요소로 남겠지만, 중앙정부는 그들의 외교와 방위만을 통제할 것입니다. 민족주의 정당이 권력을 잡을 수 있으므로 새로 형성된 자치지방에서의 권력 탈취는 가급적 피하려 노력해야 합니다.
주민들은 한층 고차원의 권력 이양을 반대했습니다. 즉, $CAPITAL$ 중앙정부가 해당 지역에 계속 전권을 행사할 것입니다. 그러나 이로 인해 민족주의자들과 대중주의자들이 미래에 더 고차원의 권력 이양을 추구하는 것을 막지는 못하게 됐습니다.
자발적 핵무기 감축
핵무기 감축 조약 취소
$COUNTRY$은(는) 현재 핵무기 감축 조약의 조인국입니다. 이는 우리나라의 핵무기 보유능력이 '낮음'보다 높지 못하게 금지하고 있어 전면적인 핵공격에 대한 대응 능력을 크게 제합합니다. 완전한 핵무기 보유능력을 갖춤으로써 핵무기 억제력을 회복하기 위해 이 조약을 취소할 수 있습니다.
최근 군사 원조 받음

당 강경파가 $MONARCHTITLE$에 대한 항의 서한을 통해 $COUNTRY$의 민주주의를 확대하는 관대한 법률을 비난하고 있습니다. 그들의 견해에 따르면, 국가와 당의 지속적인 안정을 위해서는 $COUNTRY$ 주민들에 대한 확고한 권위주의적 지배력을 유지할 필요가 필수적입니다. 그들의 충고를 경청하고 임시의회를 열어 $MONARCHITLE$에게 전제권력을 다시 쥐어줄 수도 있거니와, 그 대신 전제정치가 끝나기를 바라는 마음에서 그들을 무시하는 선택을 할 수도 있습니다. 세번째 선택지는 이들을 완전히 숙청하고 당에서 제거하는 것입니다.
정쟁
국내 정치 엘리트들이 국가의 이익을 위해 함께 일하는 대신 서로 싸우고 있습니다.
핵무기확산방지조약 포기
핵무기확산금지조약은 핵무기와 무기기술의 확산을 막고, 핵에너지의 평화적 이용에 대한 협력을 증진하며, 나아가 핵무기 군축과 일반적이고 완전한 군축이라는 목표의 달성을 목적으로 하는 국제조약입니다. 이 조약은 1965년부터 1968년까지 스위스의 제네바에 위치한 국제연합의 후원을 받는 18개국 군축위원회의 협상의 결과물입니다.
국제연합 개발원조 피원조국
국제연합 개발원조 요청

국제연합 개발계획은 국제연합은 전지구적 개발망입니다. 변화를 옹호하고 지식, 경험 및 자원으로 국가를 연결해 사람들이 스스로 더 나은 삶을 살 수 있도록 돕습니다. 개발도상국에 대한 전문가의 조언, 교육 및 지원을 제공하며, 가장 덜 발전된 국가에 대한 지원을 더욱 강조하고 국가 간 기술 및 투자 협력을 촉진합니다. 뉴욕에 본부를 둔 개발계획의 지위는 국제연합 총회 내 중역회입니다. 개발계획의 관리자는 국제연합 사무총장과 사무차장에 이어 국제연합에서 세번째로 높은 직급입니다.
적국 수도 약탈
적의 수도가 우리의 통제하에 떨어졌습니다. 과연 중대한 전쟁범죄를 저지르고 도시를 파괴해야 할까요? 비록 여러분이 그런 야만스러운 생각에 적절한 거부감을 느낄지 모르지만, 이러한 행동에는 여러 장점이 있습니다. 적국 수도 내의 문화유산을 약탈하면 염전도가 25퍼센트 상승하며, 치루고 있는 전쟁에 자금을 대는 데 필요한 자산이 많이 감소할 것입니다.

$FROMCOUNTRY$이(가) 점령한 $CAPITAL$에서 잔혹행위가 저질러졌다는 충격적인 보도가 있었습니다. 전해지는 이야기에 따르면 국가의 기념물이 파괴되고, 문화유산과 유물이 약탈당하며, $CAPITAL$ 여성들이 강간당하고 있다고 합니다. 이러한 극악한 범죄로 인해 $COUNTRY$ 국민들은 당황했지만, 일각에서는 $FROMCOUNTRY$과(와)의 싸움을 끝까지 이어가 $CAPITAL$에서 일어난 약탈에 복수하고자 하는 결의를 다졌습니다.
핵실험 금지 조약 포기
핵실험 금지 조약으로 인해 국내 연구진의 핵탄두 실험이 더욱 어려워지면서 우리나라의 핵개발 야심이 방해를 받고 있습니다. 이 조약에서 탈퇴하면 국군이 가능한 모든 수단을 사용해 작동하는 핵무기를 신속하게 구축할 수 있습니다.
핵실험 금지 조약 조인

핵무기는 전시에만 두번 쓰였으나 끔찍한 결과를 가져온 것으로 널리 알려져 있습니다. 종종 간과되는 것은 이러한 1945년 이후 최소 8개국이 2,000번 이상의 핵실험을 통해 다른 곳에서 이러한 핵무기를 '사용'했다는 사실입니다. 이러한 핵실험은 전세계 핵보유국들이 새로운 핵탄두 설계를 개발하고 핵무기 보유능력을 입증하는 데 쓰여왔습니다. 핵실험(특히 대기 중에서의 폭발)은 전 세계 수백만명의 생명과 건강에 부정적인 영향을 끼쳤습니다. 이에 대해 일반 시민, 과학자, 국회의원, 정부 지도자들은 세계적으로 검증 가능한 포괄적 핵실험 금지를 시행하기 위한 다단계적인 노력을 갈구해왔습니다.

포괄적 핵실험 금지 조약은 모든 환경에서 민간 및 군사적 목적의 모든 핵실험을 금지하는 다자간 조약입니다. 1996년 9월 10일 국제연합 총회에서 채택됐으나 특정 8개국이 이 조약을 비준하지 않았으므로 발효되지 않았습니다. 이후 수십년 동안의 지배적인 정치 상황으로 인해 1991년 냉전이 끝날 때까지 핵무기 군축은 거의 진전하지 않았습니다. 부분적 핵실험 금지 조약 당사국들은 1991년에 개정 회의를 열어 이 조약을 모든 핵무기 실험을 금지하는 것으로 바꾸자는 제안을 논의했습니다. 국제연합 총회의 강력한 지지로 1993년부터 포괄적 핵실험 금지 조약 협상이 시작됐습니다. 그 후 3년 동안 조약문 초안과 그 부속문서 두개를 작성하는 데 광범위한 노력이 있었습니다. 1996년 9월 10일 포괄적 핵실험 금지 조약이 총회 회원국의 3분의 2를 초과하는 다수결로 채택됐습니다.

부분적 핵실험 금지 조약은 1963년 지하를 제외한 장소(대기권, 우주권, 수중 등)에서의 핵무기 실험을 금지하는 조약입니다. 당초 협상은 포괄적 금지에 초점이 맞춰졌지만, 지하실험 탐지를 둘러싼 기술적 의문과 제안된 검증방식의 비타협성에 대한 소련의 우려로 이 문제는 무위로 돌아갔습니다. 실험 금지에 대한 자극은 핵실험의 규모, 특히 새로운 열핵무기 실험과 그 결과로 야기된 핵무기 낙진에 대한 국민들의 불안감이 증가함으로 인해서 제공됐습니다. 시험 금지는 핵무기 확산과 핵무기 군비 경쟁을 늦추는 수단으로도 여겨졌습니다. 비록 이 조약이 핵무기 확산 및 군비 경쟁을 멈추지는 못했지만, 이 조약의 제정은 대기 중의 방사성 입자 농도의 상당한 감소와 상관관계를 보였습니다.

$FROMCOUNTRY$ 지도부가 화학전을 피하기 위해 휴전을 제안했습니다. 이 협정의 일환으로 양국의 군대는 상호간의 모든 교전행위를 멈추고, 또 다른 충돌을 피하고 더 나은 관계를 증진하기 위해 노력할 것입니다. 국제사회는 이러한 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 지도부의 자제력을 높이 평가했습니다. 세계는 이제 $MONARCHTITLE$께서 이 올리브 가지를 잡아주시기를 기대하고 있습니다.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ 지도부가 화학전을 피하기 위해 항복에 합의했습니다. 이 협정의 일환으로 $COUNTRY$ 군대는 $FROMCOUNTRY$의 통제 영역 전체를 점령합니다. 그러나 일부 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 부대들은 항복을 거부하고 아군을 계속 공격하고 있습니다. 물론, 평화협정은 맺어야 합니다.
국내 노동자들을 괴롭혀온 만성적으로 낮은 수준의 생산성이 최근 수년 동안 상당한 진전을 보였습니다. 우리는 이러한 변화가 국내 교육의 진보 덕분이라고 생각합니다. 교육을 통해 국내 노동자들을 단순한 노동자에서 근면한 노동자로 바꿀 수 있을까요?

캠브리지 사전이 '$YEAR$년 올해의 단어'로 꼽은 '대중주의'는 각기 다른 사람들에게 다른 의미를 가집니다. 예를 들어 '장기적 비용을 고려하지 않고 단기적인 이득만을 강조하면서 복잡한 문제에 대한 간단한 설명과 해결책을 제공하고, 증거에 기반하거나 이성적 추론보다는 감정과 집단 정체성에 따라 행동하는 정치적 강령'을 설명하는 데 쓰이기도 합니다. 이런 정치적 강령들은 민주적 의사결정의 질에 대한 커져가는 의문을 보여주는데, 특히 한 트위터 게시물 당 글자를 280자로 압축해야 하는 탈진실 환경에서 온라인 콘텐츠를 보는 시간은 현재 웹페이지당 평균 8초입니다. 정치적 대중주의은 훨씬 더 불길한 의미를 가지고 있습니다. 대중주의는 '정치적 권위는 오직 사람들의 의지로부터만 정당성을 얻을 수 있으며, 그 이외의 것은 불법적'이라는 관점을 지지함으로써 전세계 여러 나라의 민주주의에 대한 이념적 도전을 늘려가고 있습니다.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ 지도부가 화학전을 피하기 위해 휴전을 제안했습니다. 이 협정의 일환으로 양국의 군대는 상호간의 모든 교전행위를 멈추고, 또 다른 충돌을 피하고 더 나은 관계를 증진하기 위해 노력할 것입니다. 국제사회는 이러한 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 지도부의 자제력을 높이 평가했습니다.
$FROMCOUNTRY$이(가)은 매우 관대한 우리의 요구를 거절함에 따라 그들을 상대로 핵탄두를 발사했습니다. 이것이 $FROMCOUNTRY$이(가) 더 이상 우리를 괴롭히지 말아야 한다는 가르침을 줬기를 바랍니다.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ 지도부가 핵전쟁을 피하기 위해 항복에 합의했습니다. 이 협정의 일환으로 $COUNTRY$ 군대는 $FROMCOUNTRY$의 통제 영역 전체를 점령합니다. 그러나 일부 $FROMCOUNTRY$ 부대들은 항복을 거부하고 아군을 계속 공격하고 있습니다. 물론, 평화협정은 맺어야 합니다.
$MONARCHITLE$, 현재 두 종류의 최후통첩을 보낼 수 있습니다. 하나는 적이 쉽게 받아들이지는 않은 총체적 항복이요, 다른 하나는 적이 받아들일 가능성이 더 높은 무조건 평화입니다. 이것은 핵무기 절멸 또는 $COUNTRY$ 역사상 최대의 승리를 좌우할 수 있습니다.
확실히 국내 경제는 활력이 넘치지 않습니다. 일부 보고서에 따르면 우리나라는 세계에서 가장 낮은 수준의 산업 생산성을 가지고 있습니다. 이는 물론 현재에도 존재하는 외국의 착취나 식민지시대의 유산 등 다양한 요인에 기인합니다. 그렇더라도 우리 경제를 근면한 경제로 전환하려면 대학진학률을 30퍼센트 이상으로 높여야 합니다.
$CAPITAL$의 사무실부터 내륙지역의 공장에 이르기까지, 우리 국민들은 열심히 일합니다. 이는 정말 힘듭니다. 이러한 근면함은 우리 경제에 있어 훌륭한 일이며, 따라서 정부는 국민들에게 감사해야 합니다. 국민들의 추진력은 농부와 인부의 생산직 노동자로의 승격률을 크게 가속화합니다.
국가 문맹도 2
국가 문맹도 1
Become $MONARCHTITLE$ for Life

$MONARCHTITLE$ for life is a title assumed by or granted to some leaders to remove their term limit irrevocably as a way of removing future challenges to their authority and legitimacy. A president for life may be regarded as a de facto monarch. Most leaders who have proclaimed themselves president for life have not in fact gone on to successfully serve a life term. Most have been deposed long before their death while others truly fulfill their title by being assassinated while in office. This decision will block all leadership elections until the $MONARCHTITLE$ dies.
$MONARCHTITLE$ 임기 제한 폐지

종신직은 일부 지도자들이 미래에 있을 수도 있는 자신의 권위와 정당성에 대한 도전을 제거하는 방법으로서 임기 제한을 없애기 위해 부여한 직함입니다. 종신대통령은 사실상의 군주로 간주됩니다. 다만 종신대통령을 자처해온 대부분의 지도자들은 사실 종신집권에 실패하는 경우가 많습니다. 대부분은 죽기 훨씬 전에 권좌에서 물러났고 그렇지 않은 사람들은 재임 중 암살됨으로써 종신집권에 성공했습니다. 이 결정을 시행하면 현직 $MONARCHTITLE$께서 사망하기 전까지 지도부 선거를 치르지 않습니다.

노벨평화상은 산업가, 발명가, 무기 제조업자인 스웨덴인 알프레드 노벨의 의지로 제정된 화학, 물리학, 생리학/의학, 문학상의 5대 노벨상 중 하나입니다. 1901년 3월부터 매년 (일부 예외 제외) '국가 간 친목 도모, 상비군 폐지 또는 감축, 평화회의 개최와 촉진을 위하여 가장 많은 또는 최선의 노력을 다한 자'에게 수여되고 있습니다. 우리 $MONARCHITLE$께서도 세계 열강 간의 평화와 선의 확보를 위한 노력의 공로를 인정받아 이 권위 있는 상을 수상하셨습니다.
